technique_name: Kimura Grip Break and Finish Mechanics
description: This instructional details the precise positioning and body mechanics required to break an opponent's defensive grip and effectively finish a Kimura. It highlights using full body weight, engaging the feet, and targeting the opponent's hand for maximum leverage to ensure a powerful and inescapable submission.

sequential_diagram_steps.label: Initial Kimura Position
sequential_diagram_steps.detail: The instructor establishes the initial Kimura grip from a side control-like position, with the opponent lying on their side.

sequential_diagram_steps.label: Body Connection and Base
sequential_diagram_steps.detail: Maintain strong chest connection to the opponent's tricep/elbow and keep toes engaged on the mat to drive weight down, preventing them from turning or escaping.

sequential_diagram_steps.label: Targeting the Grip
sequential_diagram_steps.detail: Dig your fingers deeply into the opponent's gripping hand, rather than just their wrist, and roll your wrist to create internal pressure, avoiding thumb usage for a stronger breaking force.

sequential_diagram_steps.label: Explosive Finish
sequential_diagram_steps.detail: Generate momentum by slightly lifting your knees, then execute an explosive lateral turn, keeping the opponent's arm tightly connected to your body and behind their back to complete the submission.
